result.execSummary:
The defendant Thurmond Triplett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
05-23-2017/ Judge Michael Hanrahan    
The defendant's request for release privileges is granted.   
The defendant may be released for the following:  Work.



***07-09-15/ Rebecca F. Dallet**
The Court ordered the JOC amended to reflect that the Use of A Dangerous Weapon enhancer on Count 1 is under section 939.63(1)(a), Stats.
Consecutive to: with credit for 23 days time served.

miscConds.notes: COUNTS 1 & 2: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

No firearms; weapons. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with the victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Successfully complete Batterers intervention counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Give a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
07-29-16/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 35 days, Straight Time, with credit for 24 days, of condition time in the HOC.

Stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with credit for 0 days time served.

records.addlTxt:
The defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent. Request for concurrent sentence is denied. 

SIGNED AND FILED.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michael J. Hanrahan, Br. 4, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for electronic monitoring or concurrent sentence.

Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Corrected JOC reflects  the 07-09-15 Court order  to correct penalty enhance on Count 1
Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed on 7/09/15.  Copies sent to parties.  rmm
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Rebecca Dallet, Br. 40, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify use of weapon penalty enhancer.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED AND TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 23 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Give a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Thurmond Triplett in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Thurmond Triplett in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 973.055(1), 939.63(1)(c), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thurmond Triplett in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Thurmond Triplett in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Quiana B

Defendant Thurmond Triplett in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Thurmond Triplett in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
